Class TreeNode

java.lang.Object
  TreeNode

public class TreeNode
extends java.lang.Object

Class for every word object. Tens of thousands of these are manipulated by the LanguageTree class.

Author:
Sam Glendenning

          Blank constructor, used when passing in values is not necessary

          Most commonly-used constructor.

Constructor Detail

TreeNode

public TreeNode()
Blank constructor, used when passing in values is not necessary

TreeNode

public TreeNode(float id,
                java.lang.String engWord,
                java.lang.String gerWord)
Most commonly-used constructor. Left and right are left as null because we haven't placed the node in the tree yet. These are set once that happens

Parameters:
id - - the ID constructed by the program, used as a reference number for each word. Is a float because an integer is not big enough for long words
engWord - - the String English version of the word
gerWord - - the String German version of the word

getID

public float getID()
Get the ID contained in this tree node.

Returns:
id - the ID as an float

getLeft

public TreeNode getLeft()
Fetches the node to the left of this one, used for tree traversal

Returns:
left - the left child of the current node

getRight

public TreeNode getRight()
Fetches the node to the right of this one, used for tree traversal

right - the right child of the current node

Sets the ID contained in this node

Parameters:
id - - the unique ID number of this word

setLeft

Sets the left child of this node to the one passed in, used during tree construction
